abstract.p: Article on discount vacation packages, including Mediterranean cruises, Safety Harbor Resort and Spa in Tampa Bay, Fla, BritRail Pass for trip to Wales and flights to Israel; drawing (M)

block.p: MEDITERRANEAN AUTUMN -- First European Cruises has seven discounted sailings out of Genoa aboard its 800-passenger Flamenco this autumn. The 11-night trips sail the western Mediterranean, and among the ports of call are Almeria (for a trip to Granada), Malaga, Funchal, Tenerife and Lanzarote in Spain; Safi (for Marrakesh) and Casablanca in Morocco, and Marseille. Departures are Oct. 12 and 23; Nov. 3, 14 and 25 and Dec. 16 and 26. Rates range from $890 to $2,590 a person, based on double occupancy, for the October and November sailings (versus $1,710 to $3,690 originally); December cruises are $1,520 to $2,650 a person, double ($2,000 to $3,690 originally). Round-trip air fare to Genoa is extra. A package of eight shore excursions costs $491 a person. The Flamenco has a fitness center, movie theater and casino. Cabins have phones and TV. Call First European, (888) 983-8767.

SLIMMER RATES -- From Oct. 1 to Dec. 21, the Safety Harbor Resort and Spa, on Tampa Bay, is dropping prices on its introductory spa package 20 percent. Three nights' accommodations, three meals a day for three days and a daily 25-minute massage are $372 a person, double occupancy, and $497 single. Guests have access to all spa facilities, including daily exercise classes, and, in case the walk from the parking lot is too exhausting, free valet parking. A 17.5 percent service charge and taxes are extra. Call (888) 237-8772.

WALES BY RAIL -- Sometimes, savings come by slicing off unwanted options. For those who want to visit Wales by rail but don't want to pay for a BritRail Pass, the Freedom of Wales Flexi Pass comes in two lengths. The shorter one allows four days of unlimited rail travel over eight days and bus travel all eight days, for $85 (a four-day pass for all of Britain is $235). A pass with eight days of rail travel over 15 days (again, with bus travel all 15 days included) is $159. Connections to Wales from selected cities in England are included, as are discount admissions to castles and other attractions. Rail travel does not have to be undertaken on consecutive days, but must begin after 9 a.m. on weekdays. Passes must be purchased before leaving the United States. Call (877) 677-1006.

FARES TO ISRAEL -- Funjet Vacations has round-trip flights to Tel Aviv that start at $634 from Kennedy Airport for travel Nov. 1 to Dec. 12 and Dec. 25 to March 31. From Tuesday through Oct. 31 and Dec. 13 to 24, it's $779. Fares are identical from Boston. From Chicago, they are $714 or $904, based on the same low-high periods, and from Los Angeles or San Francisco, $789 and $929. The carriers are Swissair or Sabena and fares are based on midweek travel and can be booked up to a week before departure. International fees and taxes are extra. Call Funjet at (800) 558-3000; reservation operators should be asked for the K-class fares.
